result.execSummary:
The defendant Forrest M Biersach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence Credit for 44 days if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

No contact with Faith E.  No contact with family unless they agree to it.  Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: First 2 months-NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS-To commence forthwith.  Last 4 months STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 4 months.

Defendant Forrest M Biersach in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.   Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses sentencing after revocation. State makes recommendations. Atty. Dorlack makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:  

4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 430 days)
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
	
-No contact with Faith E. unless approved by agent.
	
-AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

-Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

-No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

-Maintain/Obtain full time employment;

-Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Forrest M Biersach in court, in custody, with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense withdraws defendant's request to pursue incompetency plea.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 2 and 3,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1, 4 and 5 dismissed and read in.  Cases 13CM1948 and 14CF663 dismissed and read in to this matter and to 14CM262.

Court orders the following:

Count 2:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 44 days if revoked.
- 3 years Probation. 
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster.
- Court costs of $368.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  No contact with Faith E.  No contact with family unless they agree to it.  Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

CONDITION TIME: 6 months.  First 2 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence forthwith.  Last 4 months STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 4 months.

Count 3:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 44 days if revoked.
- 3 years Probation. 
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster.
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation: Same as Count 2.
